test_cases.name: Addition of two positive integers
test_cases.description: Tests addition of two positive integers using option 1.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, enters 5 and 7 as the two numbers.

test_cases.name: Addition of two negative integers
test_cases.description: Tests addition of two negative integers using option 1.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, enters -3 and -8 as the two numbers.

test_cases.name: Addition of a positive and a negative integer
test_cases.description: Tests addition of a positive and a negative integer using option 1.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, enters 10 and -4 as the two numbers.

test_cases.name: Addition of zero and a positive integer
test_cases.description: Tests addition of zero and a positive integer using option 1.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, enters 0 and 9 as the two numbers.

test_cases.name: Addition of zero and a negative integer
test_cases.description: Tests addition of zero and a negative integer using option 1.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, enters 0 and -7 as the two numbers.

test_cases.name: Addition of large integers
test_cases.description: Tests addition of two large integers using option 1.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, enters 1000000 and 2000000 as the two numbers.

test_cases.name: Addition of minimum and maximum integer values
test_cases.description: Tests addition of Python's minimum and maximum integer values using option 1.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, enters -2147483648 and 2147483647 as the two numbers.

test_cases.name: Addition of two zeros
test_cases.description: Tests addition of two zeros using option 1.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, enters 0 and 0 as the two numbers.

test_cases.name: Non-integer input for first number
test_cases.description: Tests behavior when the first number is not an integer.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, enters 'abc' as the first number and 5 as the second number.
test_setup.then: Program should handle the invalid input gracefully (e.g., show error or prompt again).

test_cases.name: Non-integer input for second number
test_cases.description: Tests behavior when the second number is not an integer.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, enters 5 as the first number and 'xyz' as the second number.
test_setup.then: Program should handle the invalid input gracefully (e.g., show error or prompt again).

test_cases.name: Non-integer input for both numbers
test_cases.description: Tests behavior when both numbers are not integers.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, enters 'foo' and 'bar' as the two numbers.
test_setup.then: Program should handle the invalid input gracefully (e.g., show error or prompt again).

test_cases.name: No input provided for numbers
test_cases.description: Tests behavior when user provides no input for numbers.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, presses Enter without entering numbers.
test_setup.then: Program should handle the missing input gracefully (e.g., show error or prompt again).

test_cases.name: Floating point input for numbers
test_cases.description: Tests behavior when user enters floating point numbers.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, enters 3.5 and 2.2 as the two numbers.
test_setup.then: Program should handle the invalid input gracefully (e.g., show error or prompt again).

test_cases.name: Special character input for numbers
test_cases.description: Tests behavior when user enters special characters as numbers.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, enters '@' and '#' as the two numbers.
test_setup.then: Program should handle the invalid input gracefully (e.g., show error or prompt again).

test_cases.name: Addition of two positive integers
test_cases.description: Verify that the calculator correctly adds two positive integers when option 1 is selected.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, enters 5 as the first number and 7 as the second number.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop is executed.

test_cases.name: Addition of a negative and a positive integer
test_cases.description: Verify that the calculator correctly adds a negative and a positive integer.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, enters -3 as the first number and 8 as the second number.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop is executed.

test_cases.name: Addition of two negative integers
test_cases.description: Verify that the calculator correctly adds two negative integers.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, enters -4 as the first number and -6 as the second number.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop is executed.

test_cases.name: Addition with zero
test_cases.description: Verify that the calculator correctly adds zero to another number.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, enters 0 as the first number and 9 as the second number.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop is executed.

test_cases.name: Addition of large numbers
test_cases.description: Verify that the calculator correctly adds two large numbers.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, enters 1000000 as the first number and 2000000 as the second number.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop is executed.

test_cases.name: Addition of floating point numbers
test_cases.description: Verify that the calculator correctly adds two floating point numbers.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, enters 2.5 as the first number and 3.7 as the second number.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop is executed.

test_cases.name: Invalid menu choice
test_cases.description: Verify that the calculator handles an invalid menu choice gracefully.

test_setup.given: User enters 9 as the menu choice.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop is executed.
test_setup.then: The calculator should not perform any operation and should prompt the menu again.

test_cases.name: Non-numeric input for numbers
test_cases.description: Verify that the calculator handles non-numeric input for numbers.

test_setup.given: User selects option 1, enters 'abc' as the first number.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop is executed.
test_setup.then: The calculator should display an error message or prompt the user to enter a valid number.

test_cases.name: Exit option
test_cases.description: Verify that the calculator exits when option 5 is selected.

test_setup.given: User selects option 5.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop is executed.
test_setup.then: The output should be 'Exiting...' and the loop should terminate.

test_cases.name: Subtraction operation path
test_cases.description: Verify that the calculator performs subtraction when option 2 is selected.

test_setup.given: User selects option 2, enters 10 as the first number and 4 as the second number.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop is executed.

test_cases.name: Multiplication operation path
test_cases.description: Verify that the calculator performs multiplication when option 3 is selected.

test_setup.given: User selects option 3, enters 3 as the first number and 7 as the second number.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop is executed.

test_cases.name: Division operation path
test_cases.description: Verify that the calculator performs division when option 4 is selected.

test_setup.given: User selects option 4, enters 20 as the first number and 5 as the second number.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop is executed.

test_cases.name: Division by zero
test_cases.description: Verify that the calculator handles division by zero gracefully.

test_setup.given: User selects option 4, enters 10 as the first number and 0 as the second number.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop is executed.
test_setup.then: The calculator should display an error message or handle the division by zero without crashing.

test_setup.given: User selects addition (choice 1), enters -3 and 8 as numbers.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop processes the input.

test_cases.name: Addition of two negative integers
test_cases.description: Verify that the calculator correctly adds two negative integers.

test_setup.given: User selects addition (choice 1), enters -4 and -6 as numbers.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop processes the input.

test_cases.name: Addition of zero and a number
test_cases.description: Verify that the calculator correctly adds zero and another number.

test_setup.given: User selects addition (choice 1), enters 0 and 9 as numbers.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop processes the input.

test_cases.name: Addition of boundary values
test_cases.description: Verify that the calculator correctly adds the maximum and minimum representable float values.

test_setup.given: User selects addition (choice 1), enters sys.float_info.max and -sys.float_info.max as numbers.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop processes the input.

test_cases.name: Invalid menu choice
test_cases.description: Verify that the calculator handles an invalid menu choice gracefully.

test_setup.given: User enters 9 as the menu choice.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop processes the input.
test_setup.then: An error message or prompt to enter a valid choice is displayed.

test_cases.name: Non-numeric input for numbers
test_cases.description: Verify that the calculator handles non-numeric input for numbers.

test_setup.given: User selects addition (choice 1), enters 'abc' and 5 as numbers.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop processes the input.
test_setup.then: An error message is displayed and the user is prompted to enter a valid number.

test_cases.name: Exit the calculator loop
test_cases.description: Verify that the calculator exits the loop when the user selects the exit option.

test_setup.given: User selects exit (choice 5).
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop processes the input.
test_setup.then: The loop terminates and the program ends.

test_cases.name: Addition after performing other operations
test_cases.description: Verify that the calculator can perform addition after other operations have been performed.

test_setup.given: User performs subtraction, multiplication, or division, then selects addition (choice 1) and enters 3 and 4.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop processes the input.

test_cases.name: Empty input for numbers
test_cases.description: Verify that the calculator handles empty input for numbers.

test_setup.given: User selects addition (choice 1), enters '' (empty string) for the first number and 2 for the second.
test_setup.when: The main calculator loop processes the input.
test_setup.then: An error message is displayed and the user is prompted to enter a valid number.
